metadata.feature_description: Modify user's reputation and experience points with validation and note tracking

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users and click on User Activity icon for a user
steps.expected: User Activity details panel expands showing Rank, Reputation, Experience and Edit Points button
steps.actual: User Activity panel expanded showing Rank: 3, Reputation: 6, Experience: 6, and 'Edit Points' link

steps.expected: Edit mode activates with editable textboxes for Reputation, Experience, Notes and Cancel/Save buttons
steps.actual: Edit mode activated with Reputation textbox (value: 6), Experience textbox (value: 6), Notes textarea, and Cancel/Save buttons visible

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Edit reputation points with valid value

steps.action: In edit mode, change Reputation value from 6 to 15
steps.expected: Reputation textbox accepts the new value

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Edit experience points with valid value

steps.action: In edit mode, change Experience value from 6 to 20
steps.expected: Experience textbox accepts the new value

steps.action: Enter a note in the Notes field: 'Test adjustment for QA validation - increased points'
steps.actual: Notes textarea populated with 'Test adjustment for QA validation - increased points'

steps.action: Click Save button with valid values (Reputation: 15, Experience: 20)
steps.expected: Changes saved successfully, UI reflects new values, edit mode closes
steps.actual: Changes saved successfully. Rank updated from 3 to 2, Reputation shows 15, Experience shows 20, Influence increased from 0 to 2, Last Active changed to 'moments ago'. Edit mode closed and Edit Points link is visible again.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Cancel changes and verify reset to original values

steps.action: Enter edit mode, change Reputation to 10, then click Cancel
steps.expected: Changes discarded and values reset to original values
steps.actual: After clicking Cancel, Reputation and Experience values reset to original (6, 6). Edit mode closed and Edit Points link reappeared.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Attempt to set reputation greater than experience (should fail)

steps.action: Set Reputation to 10 and Experience to 6 (reputation > experience), click Save
steps.expected: Validation error should be displayed preventing the save
steps.actual: Error message displayed: 'Reputation points can not be more than experience'. Save was rejected and edit mode remained open.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Attempt to set negative experience (should fail)

steps.action: Set Experience to -5 (negative value), click Save
steps.expected: Validation error should be displayed preventing the save
steps.actual: Server rejected the save with HTTP 500 error. Edit mode remained open with the invalid value. The server-side validation prevented saving negative experience points.

issues: Server returns 500 Internal Server Error instead of a more appropriate 400 Bad Request with a user-friendly error message for negative values. While the validation works, the error handling could be improved.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify changes reflected immediately in UI

steps.action: After saving valid changes, verify UI updates
steps.expected: All activity metrics should update to reflect new values
steps.actual: UI immediately updated: Rank changed from 3 to 2, Reputation shows 15, Experience shows 20, Influence bar now shows value 2 (was 0), Last Active shows 'moments ago'

observations: The Edit Points feature is only visible when viewing User Activity for a user, accessed via the Activity icon in the Users list
The Notes field appears to support multiline text as it is rendered as a textarea element
The Rank is automatically recalculated when points are updated (changed from 3 to 2 after increasing points)
The Influence metric also gets updated when points are modified (increased from 0 to 2)
Last Active timestamp updates to 'moments ago' after saving point changes, indicating the action is recorded as user activity
Code repository was empty so code review was not possible - all testing was conducted through UI observation
Server-side validation prevents invalid data (reputation > experience, negative values) but error messages could be more user-friendly for negative value validation
